posts.post_content:
This card is EPIC for swiping creatures that are under temporary control. For example:
  
   
[Act of Treason](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Act of Treason)   
   
Nail the guy with his own creature and then swipe it permanently... For a very low CC!
  
   
5/5

posts.post_content:
Love the art on this guy. I also love the design--this is a quintessential Johnny card because of the way it's counterintuitive and requires creativity to use successfully. (And if you do use it successfully, the payout's pretty good--see above comments on [Immortal Coil](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Immortal Coil) for example.)  
  
As to whether it's actually playable, I have my doubts.
posts.html:

As to whether it's actually playable, I have my doubts.

posts.post_content:
This thing is freaking dangerous. When you see him hit the table, kill him quick.
  
He makes Mark of Mutiny into a 3 mana "gain control of target creature permanently and put a +1/+1 counter on it."
  
Abyssal Persecutor= game goes to tie.
  
Immortal Coil = good game
  
All that in standared and in 2 colors... I can't even think of extended and beyond.

Posted By: JWolps (1/30/2010 6:49:56 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
When i saw this guy with an empty textbox in MaRo's article "The Revenge of Mons" (http://www.wizards.com/MagiC/Magazine/Article.aspx?x=mtg/daily/mm/69), i supposed him to *exchange* control or to be related to the number three because of his left hand.  
Well, it turned out that the latter suspicion wasn't even that wrong, seeing that we're having a reusable [donation](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=15168) engine here.  
Johnny definitely approves.  
And giving permanents to your opponent has indeed a very red flavor.  
This lets the clássic mono-blue [Delusions of Grandeur](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Delusions of Grandeur) Donate deck have a red spash or even allows mono-red decks.  
  
I could think of a quote this Goblin is going to say in such decks:  
"Here, have a [Jinxed Choker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Jinxed Choker)."
posts.html:
When i saw this guy with an empty textbox in MaRo's article "The Revenge of Mons" (http://www.wizards.com/MagiC/Magazine/Article.aspx?x=mtg/daily/mm/69), i supposed him to exchange control or to be related to the number three because of his left hand.
Well, it turned out that the latter suspicion wasn't even that wrong, seeing that we're having a reusable donation engine here.
Johnny definitely approves.
And giving permanents to your opponent has indeed a very red flavor.
This lets the clássic mono-blue Delusions of Grandeur Donate deck have a red spash or even allows mono-red decks.

I could think of a quote this Goblin is going to say in such decks:
"Here, have a Jinxed Choker."
